newsitem.title: UK: Heart's scores premium on market debut.
newsitem.headline: Heart's scores premium on market debut.

text.p: Shares in scottish soccer club Heart of Midlothian Plc kicked-off to a modest premium on Monday in their first day of dealings on the London Stock Exchange.
Heart's shares, issued at 140p, rose 2-1/2p to 142-1/2p by 1009 GMT in what dealers described as low volume.
Brokers said the low volume was partly due to the majority of the issue being placed with institutions which had reduced the order flow from private investors.
"With the issue being tightly held, this was not an issue we expected to see much business in," said on dealer.

Hearts', with a market capitalisation of around 14.2 million stg at the issue price, raised about five million stg from its flotation and said it would use part of the proceeds to build a new stand at its Tynecastle Park stadium.
